This game is great if you love and are used to playing Lucas Arts adventure games from way back and for those of you I've recommended this game. If you're not into that sort of thing then stay faaaaar away from this game. It does very well at being what it is but what it is can be frustrating. Three of the things you need to do in this game had no real logic behind them and some weren't really puzzles, just hidden access areas that are hard to see because of the control layout. These made me have to look up a guide which completely f**ks up the game for me because it takes away any sense of accomplishment one gets from finishing the game. Also, it's worth mentioning that the ending sucks, probably because Lucas Arts was expecting to make a sequal to the game, which never happened and now almost definitely never will. This sucks because adventure games, in my view, are 70% about the story and 30% about the gameplay so if the story fails then it's a big loss.

33997167.review:
Much like when the remastered ‘Day of the Tentacle’ came out, I bought the game and played it to completion in a few days. Sometimes remembering the puzzle, sometimes not, sometimes I even forgot whole parts of the game. These were the games I played and loved the most. Adventure games were big once, and this one, being made by Lucasarts was one of the best. Because that is what Lucasarts did, they made the best adventure games. They knew everything that was wrong with all the others and improved it with great stories, crazy situations and hilarious jokes. Full Throttle is most of these, but also breaks some of these rules.

It has horrible action sequences (which luckily you can keep trying without really dying), timed events and trail-and-error sections. You won’t find any of these in MI or DotT (they were present in the Indiana Jones adventures, though) which is why those games rate higher for me then FT does.
It’s also very short and the puzzles are easier and more logical, so normally you should be able to figure out things fairly quick, locations are also limited so you don’t spend too much time walking around a huge map trying to figure out what you missed before. It probable was, in it’s day, the most accessible adventure game for most people.
After more then 20 years the game is still great, if you like adventure games and haven’t played this one before, you should. If you played it when the original was released you should also play it.

Why? Because it’s gives you the same feeling as watching that great movie you haven’t seen for a long time and wonder why they don’t make them like they used to anymore. Even though, with upgraded graphics and all, it doesn’t feel modern and aged a bit.
The remastered graphics are great, I love that they just upgraded the original art, just as they did with DotT. The remastering of MI was a let-down for me, as it was too different from the original artwork. That is not the case here, it’s just as you remember. It’s also around this time that pre-rendered gfx was started to being used in Lucasarts adventures and, well, they don’t really age well, even in remastered form I prefer the hand drawn pixelwork any day.

One thing I find funny now, is that Tim Shafer kinda looks like Ben Throttle. I also saw the making-off video on youtube and he didn’t really look like that in the 90’s.

The game runs very well and smooth on Linux/SteamOS, it did crash on me once after multiple hours of play. I could start it up right away again, and the auto-safe system made me lose none of my progress. It works well with the Steam Controller, however using them feels weird as these games were originally made for keyboard+mouse controls. Streaming to a Steam Link is no problem either.

33901263.review:
Meh. The puzzles in this game are pretty mediocre overall, either they're too easy or way too hard. Half of the time the game doesn't make it very clear what locations you're allowed to go to. Sometimes I'm stuck on what to do for hours, and then I figure out there's somewhere else I could go to pick up another item to help me out. There was a hidden location where if you move your mouse in that exactly specific location, it'll let you go there. 

Sometimes I get stuck and then realize I wasn't pointing at the exact pixel-perfect location the item I was holding needed to be used. The Mine Road section of the game makes absolutely no sense the order in which you're supposed to defeat the bikers to get the weapons, let alone it's completely unnecessary to make you play a button mashing mini-game. 

The story is pretty interesting but there isn't a lot of plot or overworld development outside of a few cutscenes, and you don't get to meet a whole lot of NPCs outside of a few key ones. As someone who really loved Day of the Tentacle, I'd recommend giving this one a pass. It's not one of Schafer's best.

Full of great music, great quips, and a fun story line.  Full Throttle is an easy play.  Not to say that some of the puzzles aren't intersting, but there's no real "failed" state.  There's no real need to save scum, if you screw up bad enough the game lets you reset.  It's a casual game for casual point & click gamers.  The focus is clearly on the story, so don't expect too much in the way of game play challenges, just enough to keep it fun and sometimes frustrating, but the frustrating parts don't drag on forever.

A true gem from the past.

I played the original "back in the day" and it stuck as 1 of my most loved games ever.

So...TLDR: its the "original game" but with newer graphics and slightly "better" audio.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
For a long time the only way I could experiance this old gem was via an "emulator" but it worked like a charm.

Then I heared that Full Throttle Remastered was comming out which was supposed to be the "same old game but with new graphics and updated audio", so I thought I'd give it a try.

I noticed some "stuttering" on the audio and some....latancy on the bike movement on the "old mine roads" which is not present in the original game. But mostly the fighting at the mine roads had some "lag" on the mouse clicking when fighting, so I had to use the "Enter" key to "assist" my mouse... Granted - it worked but...moving on...

Overall - Its the same "old" game with new graphics - Tho I prefer the older graphics and older audio - It IS possible to change back to "old school" style, which is nice but....changing back to "old school" does not fix the issues with latency or the audio.

Bonus: Developer commentary is good because it gives a "behind the scenes" from the people who made this game.

J'adore LucasArts et leur univers mais j'étais passé à côté de ce jeu à l'époque.

J'ai donc acheté sans hésité cette version remastered, n'ayant pas été déçu par Day Of the Tentacle.

Malheureusement, j'avoue être déçu ici, ou tout du moins partagé. Certes l'univers est coooool, la musique nickel, un monde mad max sans trop d'explication vraiment chouette. Les personnages sont bien campés, mais il y en a si peu.
L'hsitoire non plus n'est pas vraiment creusée et certains passages sont longs (les combats en motos) voire vraiment énervants (la fin où il faut presque tout recommencer à chaque mort aprés un chrono...). L'humour est parfois là (l'idée des lapins mécaniques sur la chevauchée des Valkyrie !! Génial !) mais en général pas vraiment et on s'ennuie un peu.

Le côté remastered est plutôt réussi je trouve mais alors, en VF, les doublages sont castratophiques (des fois ils sont absents, reprennent, sautent des répliques) et le pire : quand la voix change à la volée entre 2 phrases. Je n'ai pas essayé en VO mais j'espère que la qualité est plus digne d'un LucasARts.

Enfin, c'est court, c'est trop simple. 

Pourtant, je me souviens de super test à l'époque mais je pense que c'était surtout pour le côté filmatographique de certains passages qui, pour le coup, ne sortent plus du tout du lot de nos jours...

Bref, au final, je ne conseille pas vraiment sauf pour les nostalgiques qui l'auraient connu à l'époque et qui veulent revivre de bons souvenirs sur une musique sympa et avec un mec qui a la classe !

33235228.review:
[h1] DISCLAIMER: This is a full review, and NOT a first impressions review

PLEASE NOTE (2017): Due to recent false accusations of plagarism, I (the reviewer) would like to stress that all these reviews and upcoming reviews are original and are not blatantly copied. Other reviews are used to help stress my point across but are changed in such a way to make the review in my own wording [/h1]

Full Throttle is a game originally developed and published by the gods of adventure games; LucasArts and has been faithfully remastered by Double Fine Productions, the same people who did Grim Fandango Remastered and Day of the Tentacle Remastered

Full Throttle's story is brilliant. From its quirky characters to its lovable cutscenes and quirky comedy. The music (especially in the remastered edition) is absolutely brilliant! The cutscenes are lovable and fun to watch, overall the game is brilliant! 

The puzzles and game progression, although when I was young and I played Full Throttle for the very first time I did not have any walkthroughs or guides, hell I didn't even have internet back in 2003 (just after playing Grim Fandango for the first time), so the puzzles were a bit challenging and can be a bit too awkward for modern-day players or even newcomers to the genre. The game does not help you at all when progressing through and does not hold your hand when your stuck on a puzzle for too long, so be prepared to get stuck here and there, thankfully I remembered most of the stuff! Lucky guys with internet nowadays, you can simply type in walkthroughs for the game!

The remastered version, Double Fine have really done a job well done for remastering this classic. The music is spot-on and digitally remastered. The cutscenes, although not fully converted to HD are very watchable, and the new HUD system they implemented has made it easier for players to play the game (honestly, the game's original controls were clunky and very awkward, surprisingly you can still play with the old controls!). The addition of HD graphics and shadow textures, etc... made the game more stunning than it originally was (and if you want some nostalgia, you can play the game in its original graphics!)

The thing that put me off slightly was the aspect ratio, this game is not tailored for 16:9 monitors and it seems that Double Fine did not optimize the game for 16:9 monitors but kept it at 4:3 aspect ratio, you can still change the aspect ratio from its original 4:3 to 16:9, but you might have to play the game stretched out.

Overall, Full Throttle and its remastered version are simply brilliant and if you are a fan of LucasArts (like me!) or you like adventure games or you want to try something new, then I would highly recommend playing Full Throttle and I hope that Double Fine will continue to remaster these old LucasArts classics!

[h1] RECOMMENDED :) [/h1]

33219779.review:

33208464.review:
The best remaster I've seen that doesn't mess with the original's feel at all, just makes it a little easier on the eyes and ears when using modern screens and decent speakers. You can even press F1 at any point to switch to the original graphics and audio. I checked out almost every scene to see how well they'd smoothed it out without making any major changes.

Like many modern point-and-click games, this lets you hold shift to see what items can be clicked on, making the pixel-hunting of older adventure games a thing of the past. This is the only real improvement to the game play, but a very welcome one (and completely optional). You can save at any point with multiple save slots. After failing a scenerio more than once or twice, I'd just save right before it to make retrying easier.

The only slight annoyance I ran into was one scene where it wasn't clear that I could click on something. The new graphics are just a 16x9 overlay running on top of the original 4x3 game, so the sides of every scene are new, but inactive graphics, just to have it fill the screen. In one scene, an item was visible to the side, but only in the newer graphics mode. I had to walk to the left to get the screen to scroll, until the object was visible in the 4x3 area of the original game. It was just confusing because I could place my cursor over the object, but couldn't select it, so I didn't think it was the answer. That only happened once, and I figured it out within 5 minutes.

Very awesome game that shouldn't be missed, whichever version you play, but the new one looks really nice. I had played the original briefly in the past, but this was my first full playthrough. It is shorter as far as 90s adventure games go, but on par with the standard for newer ones which tend to be shorter. I have about 6.5 hours in it of actual play, and I tend to be very thorough and take my time looking at things. Most people will take a little less.

33148057.review:
Full Throttle Remastered или Бессмертная Классика Квестов Теперь в Стиме


Игроки родом из 90-х наверняка любят и помнят Full Throttle, и нет нет переигрывают в него. Мы с женой кстати переигрывали недавно, еще не зная, что будет ремастер в стиме. Сразу же после анонса ремастера я добавил его себе список пожеланий и дождавшись скидки сразу же приобрел. И тут же прошел его, затратив на прохождение всего 2 часа, благо я помню игру наизусть, равно как и все диалоги и голоса актеров озвучания.
Классика, что уж тут говорить- тем кто знает что это брать однозначно, остальным можно попробовать, игрушка отличная, да и студия затратила немало сил на полную перерисовку игры, не утратив при этом ни духа игры ни атмосферы.

(А теперь ностальгия, мало имеющая отношение к описываемой игре)
Узнал я об этой игре в году примерно 95-м, из журнала Магазин игрушек, который в дальнейшем мутировал в Game.exe, но потерял при этом "теплую ламповость". Расскаматривая страницы в журнале меня привлекли картинки из FT, и я принялся изучать статью. Авторы нахваливали игру, и как сейчас помню поражались, что "игра в архивированном состоянии занимает аж 175 мб". Меня поражали эти цифры, ведь имея комп 386DX40 c 4 метрами оперативы и с жестким диском в 210 Мб эти цифры не укладывались в голове...Будущее наступило... в месте с моим разачарованием, что для игры нужен CD-Rom и Sound Blaster. Что это такое, я понятия не имел и сильно огорчался...Некоторое время спустя я и мой батя пошли в компьютерную фирму, докупили еще 4 метра оперативы и дорогущий набор от Creative включающий в себя 2 скоростной Cd-rom и Sound Blaster 16. Не буду описывать тот восторг, который я испытал, когда мне продемонтстрировали возможности новых железок в игре Doom2 (это отдельная история, и займет страницу текста) - ЭТО БЫЛО НЕЧТО!. Одной из первых игр на CD диске приобретенной мне родителями как раз стал FT. Игра радовала и поражала, и малейшее продвижение по сюжету вызывало дикий восторг, потому как ютуба с прохождениями, не говоря про статьи не было, да что уж там говорить - купить номер Магазина Игрушек  (или другую игровую прессу) была большая удача, но и там не было гайдов. Игра проходилась с помощью друзей/знакомых - встретишь бывало кого-то - спросишь: "А ты в FT прошел то-то и то-то?". "Да, там нужно так-то и так-то". Пулей домой, отлично прошел... играем дальше...
Это сейчас комюнити огромандное и компьютер у каждого первого, а вот тогда... Эх...

Оценка б/о

32993643.review:
68K時代のMacを使っていた頃、ルーカスアーツのゲームはCD-ROMというメディアを活かした秀作が非常に多かった。

Loomやモンキーアイランドはもちろんの事、スターウォーズ関連等も充実しており、どれも映画ばりのストーリー性のあるゲームばかり。しかもMacでプレイできるというところが個人的に魅力でもあった。

このフルスロットルは、とあるアキバのソフト屋で見かけた時、Macでもきる面白そうなパッケージで、かつハズレのないルーカスアーツというのもあり迷わずに購入した。
キャッチコピーはヘヴィメタルアドベンチャー「640メガのなんとか」（忘れたｗ）で、当時のCD-ROMの大容量をめいいっぱいつかった、ということなんだろうと思うが、このスチーム版は640メガどころか「5ギガ」以上ある（笑）

スムージングとHD化、それとBGMがおそらくCDクォリティになっている。昔のと聴き比べたら音質が格段によくなっていた。
オープニングのアメリカンらしいハードロックは何度聞いても飽きない。アニメ調の作品のせいか、今見ても遜色あるようにはまったく見えない。
スチーム版はリマスターとクラシックの二つ入っているのは非常に嬉しいことだが、さすがに5ギガはちょっと驚いた。

惜しくも完全日本語化はされておらず、というかまったくされてない。
当時の同梱品では日本語マニュアルとヒント集だけはあったが、英語をなんとかわからないなりにも読解し、おそらくはストーリーの「半分」ぐらいは進んだ記憶がある。つまり、クリアーできなかったわけだ。

未だにどう解いていいかわからないステージがあり、今も昔もネット情報も皆無とあってはもはややりようがないと諦め、もう２０年近くが過ぎてしまっていた。

有志の日本語化などアテにもできないので、クリアーするには英語力が必須だ。
この度スチームで配信され、めでたくMacにも対応しているので迷わずに購入したので、記念にこのレビューをしておいた。

一度諦めかけたゲームだが、今度こそクリアーしてみたいと思っている！

オープニングやBGM、アメリカンな世界観が最高にいい雰囲気だしているので、気になる人はプレイしてみはどうだろうか！？

Hallo ^.^/

Full Throttle oder auch bekannt als Vollgas, macht damals sowie heute eine menge Spaß. Natürlich haben wir ein oder zwei Szenen die einem tierisch auf die Nerven gehen und man am liebsten das Spiel sofort wieder ausmachen will, weil es nicht so klappt wie man es möchte.. doch nicht verzagen einfach dran bleiben! (es lohnt sich).
Jeder der das Spiel damals als lustige Pixelgrafik gespielt hat, kann sich vielleicht an das ein oder andere Rätsel erinnern, und kommt demnach flott durch das Spielgeschehen.

Wo wir bei Rätsel sind - Schwierigkeitsgrad der Rätsel würde ich auf leicht bis mittel einstufen, es ist kein Rätsel unlösbar, man muss halt nur etwas um die Ecke denken, das klappt es auch schon ;)

Ein paar Lustige Szenen sind natürlich auch wieder dabei, wie man es von Lucas Art kennt.

Leider ist die Story recht kurz gehalten, was ich Persönlich sehr schade finde. Man hätte da noch ein bisschen mehr rausholen können, meiner Meinung nach. Und ich finde 14,99€ für das Spiel auch wenn es Remastered ist, ein bisschen zu teuer nur das man eine Spieldauer von ca. 4-5 Stunden hat (je nachdem wie schnell man ist, kann es sogar noch kürzer sein).

Im großen und ganzen, hat mir das Spiel trotzdem gefallen und ich würde es immer wieder Spielen. Kann es daher jedem Empfehlen, wobei ich sagen muss wartet lieber bis es etwas Günstiger ist ;)

32973086.review:
When I was a kid, I remember other classmates mouthing off words watching movies like Mulan. For me, It was full throttle.

I'm glad I was able to play this again remastered. People don't realize this, but the reason why this game is so short is, 1): LucasArts had to cut so much stuff from development and 2): Fundamentally, the character in this adventure game was short and to the point, and it was reflected on some of the simple puzzles. It was more of a practical game, you needed a hose and gas can to siphon off gas, and use your lips on the hose to kickstart it.

In essence, this game was and is the complete opposite of Ron Gilbert's Secret of Monkey Island. Instead of combining seemingly wacky but useless items into something actually useful, or resolving situations in a creatively non-violent way, Full Throttle tackles most problems head on, with few puzzles requiring something you wouldn't have brute-force your way out of.

Like i said, this line of thought kind of goes off the rails in the later parts of the game, but even with the nostalgia baggage, I consider this game to be one of the shortest but sweetest point and click adventure games out there.

One problem I'd like to make note of, and help highlight it so that other players will be more cautious...The biker fighting section. When you are riding and fighting other bikers, you cannot save your game, and I have had my game crash at least once when losing a fight, losing all of my progress. I recommend that you take an exit out of the mine road, and ride to a place you can save before heading out again, especially if you made good progress without saving.

Other than that, I highly recommend this game to newcomers and players who have played it alike. If you finished the game before, i reccomend starting the game with developer commentary, and anybody new to it, just play the game the way it was intended to be.

32474598.review:
En vingt ans, le game design de Full Throttle a certes vieilli (des séquences d'action lourdingues, des puzzles dont la résolution se joue au pixel près). Mais le jeu reste une pépite de l'âge d'or de LucasArts.

Full Throttle a l'avantage de ne pas être trop long (cinq heures environ, sans se presser), de proposer un univers réellement original (ni contemporainl, ni véritablement post-apo à la Mad Max) et d'aligner les dialogues et stuations hilarants.

La remastérisation est très réussie, respectueuse du jeu original. Plus d'une centaine de concept arts sont à débloquer, et les commentaires audio sont passionnants (à écouter en parcourant le jeu une seconde fois).

Bref, une réussite.

32442586.review:
22 Jahre später gibt es nun also ein Remaster von einem meiner Lieblingsspiele als Teenager.
Full Throttle hat vielleicht nicht ganz den Humor anderer LucasArts-Adventures und die Rätsel stellen keine großen Herausforderungen dar, dafür bekommt man jedoch jede Menge Cutscenes und eine überzeugende Handlung geboten, garniert mit einer aufgehübschten Grafik, die den Charme des Klassikers bewahrt.

Dies ist eines der ersten Adventures der damaligen Zeit, dass auf das klassische Interface von Point&Click-Adventures (eine umfassende Ansammlung von Verben unter dem Hauptbildschirm) verzichtet und auf ein Interaktives setzt, was damals wie heute sehr angenehm ist. Ebenso ist der Umgang mit dem Inventar durch drag&drop sehr einfach.
Die Remastered-Version bietet die Möglichkeit mittels Tastendruck alles, womit man interagieren kann, hervorzuheben. Dies kann nach Belieben in den Optionen geändert werden. Man hat bei mehreren Einstellungen (Gameplay, Steuerung, SFX, etc.) die Wahl zwischen Klassisch und Remastered. Da man sogar Ingame die Grafik zwischen der alten und neuen Version des Spiels hin- und herschalten kann, kommen hier sicher Nostalgiker auf ihre Kosten.

Positiv zu bewerten ist auch, dass Full Throttle einige Extras für den Interessierten Spieler zu bieten hat:
54 Audiokommentare der Entwickler (höchst interessante Hintergrundgeschichten), die Ingame sogar mit deutschen Untertiteln abgespielt werden können oder auch außerhalb im Hauptmenü über die Jukebox. Letztgenannte bietet überdies noch den Soundtrack (55 Titel).
Außerdem gibt es noch eine Galerie mit 147 Konzeptzeichnungen oben drauf.

Nun aber zu den Dingen, die negativ aufgefallen sind. Dies betrifft zum größten Teil die Qualität der Sprachausgabe. Während der Klang der englischen Original-Stimmen etwas überarbeitet worden zu sein scheint, hat man bei den deutschen Stimmen das Gefühl, noch in der Mitte der 90er Jahre festzustecken, was für mich persönlich zwar zu verschmerzen, trotzdem aber ein wenig enttäuschend ist. Bitter aufstoßen tut der Umstand, dass in der deutschen Version einige Charaktere manchmal, wenn auch nur sehr selten und meist auch nur für ein Wort, mit der Stimme eines anderen Charakters sprechen.
Beim Szenenwechsel kommt es hin und wieder zum abrupten Stopp der Musik oder Sprachausgabe, was die Stimmen dann etwas abgehackt klingen lässt. Das Spiel ist mir bei mehrmaligem Durchspielen insgesamt zweimal abgestürzt.

Fazit:
Trotz der oben genannten Schwächen kann ich Full Throttle jedem Nostalgiker und allen anderen, die etwas für Adventures übrig haben, empfehlen. Wem die kurze Spielzeit oder die leichten Rätsel abschreckt, sollte spätestens im Sale zugreifen.
Wer ein technisch makelloses Adventure oder anspruchsvolle Rätsel sucht wird hier allerdings nicht fündig.

32422335.review:

Full Throttle (Remastered) : le Point and Click des années 90 est de retour (en Harley Davidson).

Pour le test vidéo c’est ici : https://youtu.be/EhSg7G5ksmA
Résumé: 
++ C’est toujours un plaisir de retrouver une perle du point-and-click de chez LucasArts.
++ L’univers Motards-Gros lourdauds. 
++ Dialogues bien écrit avec de la vanne « qui va bien ».
++ Le coup de polish graphique et sonore.
+   La possibilité de zapper entre la version originale et remastered à tout moment.

-  Scénario moins fouillé et moins décalé que la plupart des jeux LucasArts.
-  La qualité du son qui reste parfois inégale.
-  Plus proche d’un film interactif que d’un jeu vidéo.
-- Gros Problèmes de lisibilité (chemins, accès, objets difficilement visibles).
-- Se retrouver bloqué par un manque de visibilité, pas à cause d’un manque de matière grise.
-- Les pixels sur un écran 15’’ ça passe mais sur un 26’’ en HD, ça se transforme en bouillie de pixels.
-- 15 Euros : La nostalgie coûte cher au joueur.

32131056.review:
DISCLAIMER: Не играл в оригинальную игру, поэтому обзор написан с точки зрения любителя квестов и адвечур, не отягощенного многочисленными приступами ностальгии.

Когда-то в далеком 1995 году игра Full Throttle возможно и была шедевром, но сейчас Full Throttle Remastered - довольно-таки средненький квест. Игра сильно не дотягивает до современных топовых адвенчур, таких как Deponia, Life is Strange и The Walking Dead S1 от Telltale. 
И дело тут даже не в классической механике (те же Broken Sword 1 и 2 даже без перерисовки играются отлично). Дело в очень бедном наполнении игры. Игра очень короткая, полностью проходится за 4 часа, крайне мало диалогов, мало локаций, мало активных предметов, мало реплик главного героя по поводу происходящего вокруг, режиссура и анимация роликов хромают. Из-за столь скудного контента Full Throttle просто не успевает как следует раскрыть персонажей, описать мир, в котором происходит действие, создать атмосферу. Сюжет стремится вперед семимильными шагами, не давая передохнуть и осознать происходящее.
Но тем не менее Full Throttle Remastered - хороший ремейк. Все качественно перерисовано, музыка и звуковые эффекты переработаны под современные стандарты. Забавно, что можно сравнивать версии на лету - по нажатию кнопки F1 в любой момент происходит переключение между "классическим" и "новым" аудиовизуальными стилями игры.

Резюмируя вышесказанное - 6/10. Full Throttle Remastered отлично подойдет ценителям оригинальной игры и большим любителям жанра, но не более того.

31962111.review:
Meu pai sempre foi fã de Star Wars. Em um natal, minha mãe o presenteou com o primeiro box em VHS remasterizado do Star Wars, e junto dos filmes, veio um CD-ROM com alguns demos pra lá de interessantes.
   Nessa época, nós tínhamos um Compaq 486 com monitor de fósforo verde, pentium 2 de 112mhz, incríveis 50mb de memória RAM e sem CD-ROM.
   Claro, que após meu pai abrir o presente dele e ver a pérola que tínhamos em mãos, ele pensou: "Hora de fazer um Upgrade."
   Crescer durante os anos 90 foi uma experiência incrível. Os jogos estavam evoluindo de pequenos pixels coloridos para animações inteiras.
   Após trocarmos o monitor por um colorido, instalarmos um drive de CD e a famigera placa de som SoundBlaster 16, finalomente conseguimos experimentar as experiências de jogar Rebel Assault, Dark Forces, The Dig e... Full Throttle.
   Full Throttle permeou minha infâncai, do meu irmão e do meu primo. Nós jogamos muito esse demo. Jogamos tanto que o CD simplesmente desgastou. Então, depois de muito torrar a paciência do meu pai, (hoje ele admite que também não via a hora de comprar o completo) finalmente, ele comprou o orginal.
   No momento que vímos a abertura, ja ficamos incrivelmente imersos naquela narrativa incrível.
   Hoje, depois de 14 horas e 4 finais completos siguidos, finalmente venho lhes escrever que, ter a oportunidade de jogar esse clássico em alta definição, foi realmente, uma experiência incrível, memorável e inesquecível como foi jogar a versão original lá em 1995.
   Existem alguns pequenos defeitos no remaster que não existiam no original, como a ausência de movimento do background ou a inversão de cor no puzzle da reunião de acionistas (que retornam se vc usar o render clássico), ou o som  que dá umas quebradas de vez em quando, mas nada disso tira a emoção de jogar esse jogo novamente com essa definição gloriosa.
   Esse clássico pode não servir a todos os gostos, principalmente da molecada de hoje, que não sabe como era treta fazer um jogo desse nível naquela época, mas ele, com certeza, merece uma chance.
   Se você é fã de advetures poiunt'n'click então, com certeza deve jogar essa obra de arte menosprezada da LucasArts!

Não existe avaliação na escala leomaníaca pra esse jogo pois o apontador não vai além de 10/10 e não leva em consideração lágrimas de nostalgia e emoção! (Meu velho tbm ficou todo marejado)

31897144.review:
1995. Damals kaufte man sich Spiele noch im Laden. In einem schönen Pappkarton erhielt man ein Booklet und das Game auf CD. Was waren das bloss für verrückte Zeiten!

Mit "Full Throttle" entführte uns die legendäre Spieleschmiede LucasArts mit vollgas in ein kurzweiliges (weil tatsächlich kurzes) Biker-Adventure. Der Schwerpunkt lag weniger auf den Rätseln und mehr auf der tollen Musikkulisse und den zahlreichen Videosequenzen. Von daher ging der Titel beinahe in Richtung intaraktiver Roadmovie statt Aventure, wie man es von "Indiana Jones", "Day of the Tentacle" und "Monkey Island" gewohnt war.

Ja, der Titel ist pure Nostalgie im bestmöglichen Sinne. In der Remastered-Fassung wirkt das Spiel so, wie es sich damals anfühlte. Grafisch wurde es nun so nett aufpoliert, dass auch junge Gamer bedenkenlos zugreifen können - sollten sie den tatsächlich den Wunsch verspüren, einen wahren Klassiker zu spielen. Und ich meine das wortwörtlich, denn sie "sollten" tatsächlich und dürften es kaum bereuen.

31882215.review:
[h1][b]САМЫЙ ЛУЧШИЙ КВЕСТ![/b][/h1] 
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=930104109
На протяжении долгих лет [b]Full Throttle[/b] оставалась для меня легендарной, но упущенной игрой. Я миллион раз слышал кучу хвалебных слов в её адрес, всякие воспоминания, посты, участие в топах "[i]самых крутых квестов ever"[/i] и т.д. Руки не доходили, а ей уже стукнуло больше 20 лет! Прошло какое-то время и неожиданно для многих анонсировали ремастер, на что я сказал: [i]"Ну теперь уж точно заценю"![/i] И вот, она передо мной любезно открыла двери и погрузила в небольшую, но чертовски крутую историю. Ну а главный сюрприз оказался именно в переиздании. На мой взгляд лучший ремастер когда-либо выпущенный!
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=930104159
Для тех, кто как я – слоупок, или тупо пропустил [b]Full Throttle[/b] – легендарный квест (графическая адвенчура) старой школы разработанный культовой конторой [b]Lucasarts.[/b] Главным автором является [i]Тим Шейфер,[/i] из-под пера которого вышло много крутых игр и историй. Многие называют это его лучший работой, и я с этим соглашусь! [b]FT[/b] сейчас не просто играется свежо и не обычно, у неё спустя мать его почти четверть века даже близко не появилось аналогов по истории и сеттингу. Своеобразный постапокалиптический мир где большинство людей пересели на летающие автомобили, а колёса и транспорт на нём практически умерли. Лидер байкерской банды [i]Хорьки – Бен[/i] (по совместительству главный герой) окажется втянут в драки, гонки, предательства и даже в криминальное дело касающееся последний фирмы выпускающей байки на колёсах. Сейчас сюжет не кажется гениальным, но вокруг него построенная замечательная адвенчура, самое настоящее приключение. Уникальное, весёлое, драйвовое. Моментально забываешь, что перед тобой квест 95 года, настолько сильно увлекает, наслаждаешься каждым диалогам и решением головоломки. Все они кстати 100% логичные, никаких глупостей, хоть и догадаться порой весьма сложно. Сам геймплей несколько раз поменяется и нам дадут, к примеру, поучавствовать в драках на мотоциклах, чего вообще не ожидал увидеть. Наконец-то я проникся этим приключением и понял за что её так все любят. Конечно же ещё за крутецкую музыку в сауднтрэке, когда-то её в журнале [i]"Игромания"[/i] на диски закидывали.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=930104189
С выходом ремастера она стала в 10 раз лучше. Для начала - перерисовали всю графику. То есть локации, персонажей, задники, причём на восхитительном уровне, мой поклон. Добавили режим 16 на 9, а также - достижения! И ещё одну вещь от которой я до сих пор в шоке, она просто гениальна! В любое время вы можете нажать клавишу [i]F1[/i] и моментально включается старый рендер, и вы видите игру из 95 года, с той картинкой и звуком. ЭТО ПРОСТО ШЕДЕВРАЛЬНАЯ ФУНКЦИЯ! Все 3 часа прохождения я клацал [i]F1[/i] кучу раз и сравнивал новое со старым, смотрел мельчайшие изменённые детали и т.д. Ясен пень проходить можно и искомую версию, получается перед нами ремастер внутри которого можно играть в оригинал, фильм [i]"Начало"[/i] просто отдыхает. Такой кнопкой должны обладать все ремейки и ремастеры! Под финал могу сказать, что [b]Full Throttle[/b] фантастически крутая игра, а людей, делавших её ремастер нужно расцеловать. Господи, да она даже стоит всего 350 рублей! Отдельное, гигантское спасибище подписку предоставившему гифт. Абсолютно всем рекомендую, даже если вы как я не особо любите квесты, эта игра того стоит! Меньше 10 из 10 поставить невозможно.

31874015.review:
[h1]¿Quieren saber por qué compré este juego?[/h1]
[b]Nostalgia[/b]. Y porque nunca jugué el original.

Si eres un "niño" de los ´90 como yo, quizás te interese jugar esta versión remastered

[u]Acerca del Juego:[/u]
Encarnamos a [b]Ben Throttle[/b], el lider de la banda de motoqueros Polecats. Recibimos una oferta de trabajo, para luego darnos cuenta que alguien nos traiciona

[u]Jugabilidad:[/u]
Es [b]point & click[/b] tradicional, pero cambia el listado de verbos que vimos por ejemplo en los Monkey Island, por íconos de: ojos, boca, puño y patada

[u]Rendimiento:[/u]
La performance del juego es muy buena, corre sin problemas a 60 FPS o más
Corre como la seda, ni un solo crash

[u]Positivos:[/u]
+ Es un juego diseñado por el legendario [b]Tim Schafer[/b], ícono de las aventuras gráficas de los años ´90, y a día de hoy continua diseñando buenos juegos
+ El actor que encarnó a [b]Luke Skywalker[/b] en la [b]Guerra de las Galaxias[/b] (Mark Hamill), hace varias voces para este juego
+ Excelente arte, estilo visual y animaciones, muy caricaturezco
+ 40 logros relativamente sencillos de obtener
+ Soporta teclado/mouse y control/mando
+ Como siempre, podemos cambiar entre los gráficos/música/sonido originales, y las versiones remasterizadas, en tiempo real, con sólo pulsar un botón
+ Buena banda sonora

[u]Negativos:[/u]
- Es un juego demasiado corto, igual que el original :(
- Como aventura gráfica, NO es de lo mejorcito del género. El inventario es bastante pequeño, y no podemos combinar demasiados objetos. Los puzzles son relativamente simples
- Hay momentos donde debemos combatir contra otros personajes mientras vamos andando en la motocicleta, pero el combate es bastante tonto... Para ganar debemos tener el arma correcta contra cada tipo de enemigo (quien nos aparece de forma aleatoria), y luego simplemente presionar botones hasta ganar
- Hasta el momento no hay ports para Mac ni Linux... espero que en un futuro cercano remedien esto

[u]Otros juegos recomendados:[/u]
- [b]Brütal Legend[/b] (acción, aventura, estrategia en tiempo real, y excelente música heavy metal \m/)
- [b]Day of the Tentacle Remastered[/b]
- La serie [b]Monkey Island[/b]

31849645.review: This one is pure nostalgia for older gamers..  Great graphics revamp, but forgot how short it was!..  If you've never heard of this game, it's a great little story, but you might want to wait for a special to come for it..  If I'd never played it before, I would think $15 is too much.  I still kind of do, I think it cost $20 back in '95.  If you're into point and click adventure though, it's a good time.

31847545.review: Ich hab das Spiel in den Neunzigern nicht gespielt und war nach Thimbleweed Park in etwas nostalgischer Stimmung, so dass ich das Versäumnis von Full Throttle nachholen wollte. Leider konnte mich das Spiel nicht überzeugen. Die Story und die Charaktere sind natürlich Geschmackssasche, aber die Rätsel und die Actionsequenzen waren eher ermüdent. "Trial an Error" und sich wiederholende Animationen bei Versagen empfand ich schon als etwas nervig. Vorteilhaft war lediglich, dass man innerhalb weniger Bilder bleibt und mit wenigen Gegenständen konfrontiert wird. Die Dialoge sind ziemlich banal und haben, meines Wissens, keinen Einfluss auf das Spiel. Der Humor aus anderen Tim Schafer-/Ron Gilbert-Spielen wäre hier wahrscheinlich auch fehl am Platz, aber etwas anspruchsvoller hätten die Dialoge gestaltet werden können. Zu guter Letzt ist das Spiel relativ kurz, wenn man von den Videos absieht. Für mich ein eher durchschnittliches Adventure.

31742546.review: Finally decided to try this game after missing it in the 90s, but I was shocked how bad this game really is compared to all the previous games in this genre. There were like 10 two-step puzzles in total, unnecessary, unfair and trivial action scenes and few extremely frustrating try-every-combination-until-you-don't-die puzzles without any sort of hint for the solution, which almost made a grown-up man cry. The dialog was boring and throughout the entire game it felt like the voice actors were just reading lines from a piece of paper in 30 minutes and went home, just like I was just waiting for the game to end to get out of my misery, which wasn't eventually a long time to wait. As for the remastered graphics, they were not that good except for the characters, and in general it felt more like the old graphics were just pushed through some smoothing filter. I did enjoy the previous remastered adventure games a lot, but this game could've just left rest in peace.

Liked the hand drawn art (including some impressive pixel work in the original renderer), and it has some nostalgia value. But not in the same league as Day of the Tentacle and Grim Fandango.

Full Throttle is still as short a point 'n' click adventure now as it was back in 1995 and the remastered version isn't quite as polished as recent efforts by Double Fine such as Day of the Tentacle Remastered, however this is still the same awesome bikie adventure that many gamers fell in love with back in the 90s, with an excellent soundtrack by Peter McConnell and the Gone Jackals, a great cast of characters voiced by some talented voice actors, and an appealing comic book art style – the only difference is it's all in higher definition now so that a younger generation can enjoy it too without needing to experience grainy animation and audio.

31532052.review: The quality of this remaster is great! I never played the original, but I was hooked on this game from beginning to end. I went in skeptical of the game, since I have never played/been incredibly interested in point and click adventure games. As it turns out, this game is great! The only problem I had was with a lot of the puzzles which followed barely any logic, or more accurately, old point and click game logic, but part of the charm of the game is finding out that you need to steal a box of bunnies and release them into a minefield, or throw fertilizer in a biker's eyes in order to obtain a chainsaw. Overall, the game is great, and the ability to switch between the original graphics and the remastered at will really shows off how well done the new graphics are. Thanks Double Fine for creating such a great game, and huge thank you to Shiny Shoe for putting so much work in order to make sure this remaster was a success!

31512157.review:
Ich bedanke mich bei den Entwicklern für dieses tolle Remaster. Alles richtig gemacht. Als ich (mehr durch Zufall) mitbekommen habe, dass es Full Throttle jetzt als Remaster gibt und auch noch die deutsche Tonspur mit den Original-Sprechern dabei ist gab es kein Halten mehr. Ein absolut gelungenes Meisterwerk.

Natürlich wurden auch die nervigen Parts übernommen, was in einigen Tests kritisiert wurde (Old Mine Road, Derby), aber das gehört halt auch irgendwie mit dazu. Hätte man diese rausgeschnitten oder vereinfacht würde was fehlen. Außerdem ist das Spiel etwas kurz geraten, aber was will man machen; das Original war auch nicht länger und der Preis von 15€ ist nun wirklich fair.

Besonders gelungen finde ich das Feature, dass man zwischen den alten Grafiken und den Neuen hin und her wechseln kann. Von diesem Remake kann sich so mache Firma eine Scheibe abschneiden.

Ich hoffe die Entwickler nehmen sich als nächstes "Simon the Sorcerer" vor. Auch ein wundervolles Point & Click-Adventure.

31511002.review: If you came from the golden age of LucasArts point and click adventure games, this one will certainly scratch that itch. It felt a lot shorter than I remember, as I played it when I was 11 years old. The game allows the "throwback" graphics if you want the original experience. The remaster is excellent due to its addition of developer commentary and a slough of bonus content. The voice acting is exceptional and the graphics overhaul were very good.

31501575.review:
Essa é uma remasterização que dá gosto de ver. O jogo é um clássico da história dos video games, então elogiar o jogo é chover no molhado. Recomendado para quem jogou o original, para quem é fã de point and click ou para quem quer conhecer esse jogo tão imporantante e marcante na história dos video games.

Reamsterização do audio original incrementando a sua qualidade, refizeram as animações do jogo completamente, com uma qualidade visual que ficou sensacional.

Você ganha dois jogos ao comprar essa remaster, pois o jogo com os graficos originais vem junto e você pode alternar entre a versão remaster ou original a qualquer momento simplemente apertando F2 ou o select do controle, nunca tinha visto isso em remaster antes, que isso vire um padrão.

Tem pequenos problemas na otimização, o audio do jogo desincroniza em algumas cutcenes, e de defeito é só.

31501477.review: This is one of the most solid remasters I've ever played. Like many on here, I grew up with this game and I consider this specific one as one LucasArts' crown jewels in their adventure game library. Those that are fans of the game, know the game. If you like adventure games, this one is essential playing. The remaster itself is so well done that it's apparent a lot of TLC went into its making. Switching between the original and remastered artwork is seamless and additional interface features have been added. Among those is a highlight feature that illuminates interactable objects and environment elements. Another is gamepad integration that works fairly well if you want to kick back and play on the living room TV. The audio is crisp and punchier than the original due to original tape access by the dev team. Everything has been redrawn and animated and everything is done with surgical care. The game is now 16:9 and seeing this game fill my HDTV was gaming nirvana. This remaster commands a second play through just for the developer commentary.

31482205.review:
Full Throttle im neuen Look hat mir sehr gut gefallen.
Die Modernisierung des Äußeren hat dem Spiel definitiv gut getan, ohne das Feeling,
dass es den 90ern ausstrahlte, zu zerstören.

Es bleibt aber nicht nur bei diesem „Facelifiting“, sondern man hat sich die Mühe gemacht,
andere Sprachausgaben hinzuzufügen und interessante Bonusinhalte beizusteuern.
Die deutsche Synchronfassung ist anständig, reicht aber nicht an das amerikanische Original heran und letztendlich habe ich sie auf die Originalsprache umgestellt.
Bei den Boni, dürften wohl der Entwicklerkommentar und die Konzeptzeichnungen am interessantesten sein.
Wer sich hier etw. Zeit nimmt, erhält einen Einblick in die Entwicklungsphase von Full Throttle.
Hier bekommt man beispielsweise die unterschiedlichen Ideen für Schauplätze und Charaktere, bis zur finalen Version im Spiel, zu sehen.
Die Jukebox aus dem Bonusbereich hat mich weniger interessiert.

Vom Spiel selbst kann man natürlich nichts Neues erwarten, es ist nun einmal dasselbe geblieben ;).
Es gibt allerdings zwei Steuerungsoptionen, remastered und die originale.
Es sind zwar nur kleine Unterschiede aber sie waren, für mich, der Full Throttle im Original kennt, zu spüren.

Ich kann dieses Spiel jedem empfehlen sich der Nostalgie hingeben möchte oder einfach ein gutes altes Spiel der Lucas Arts- Ära im neuen Outfit erleben möchte.

31465787.review:

After playing through the remaster, I really have to commend Doublefine for doing such a good job on updating the look of the game...switching back and forth between remastered and classic, the attention to detail is amazing.

As for cons, the only things I can think of is there are the odd bugs here and there (eg. audio slightly off by a millisecond when changing scenes sometimes, credits didn't display for some reason, etc), some of the puzzles do show their age, and the game is rather short at around 3 hours (if you remember the puzzles)...but that said, if you enjoyed this game back in 1995, then buying the remaster is a no-brainer.  Looking forward to them adding cards (in future I guess?), and will likely replay it at that time with commentary on to get the full experience.

31425557.review:
С Full Throttle у меня сложные отношения. Я не считаю ее шедевром, а некоторые элементы игрового процесса в ней, мягко говоря, спорные. Full Throttle в первую очередь благодаря своей истории и атмосфере, а как игра она была далека от идеала. Спасибо ремастеру, что напомнил мне про эти кошмарные аркадные эпизоды с драками на байках и управлением машиной в дерби на стадионе, про местами невыносимый пискельхантинг, про иногда страдающую логику у пазлов... Многие и так в курсе о чем идет речь, просто большинство обожает эту игру именно за ее атмосферу, а не за то что это хороший квест, и закрывают на эти недостатки глаза.

Ладно, не буду уже излишне сгущать краски. Это скорее пинок в сторону ремастера, а не оригинала - разработчики попытались исправить проблемы, но у них это местами не очень хорошо получилось. Те аркадные эпизоды и в оригинале не были особой проблемой, если вы знали о волшебной комбинации клавиш Shift+V, которая безотказно работает и в ремастере. А вот проблему пиксельхантинга решили странно - подсветку активных мест прикрутили, однако подсвечивает оно только предметы, хотя главной проблемой были не они, а нахождение точек перехода на другой экран. Я хоть и прошел оригинал, но с ходу не смог вспомнить особо издевательские места вроде кабины крана на свалке, а в ремастере это еще больше сбивает с толку, ведь предметы подсвечены, а точки перехода остались неотмеченными и только сильнее сливаются с фоном. Даже к обновленной графике есть вопросы, большую часть экранов обновили хорошо, но на некоторые вещи вроде прожекторов полиции, облаков и отдельных 3D-моделей просто больно смотреть:
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=910205317
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=910205497
Хорошо, что как и в ремастерах Monkey Island 1-2 в любой момент можно переключиться на старую версию по нажатию клавиши F1, так что если вдруг почуете что-то неладное, то можно самим проверить и убедиться. Мне вот особенно больно за облака над заводом "Corley Motors", скриншотами это не передать, но небо там в оригинале было анимированным, а в ремастере оно почему-то полностью статичное. Такие вот "улучшения" облаков изменили настрой некоторых сцен и тем самым немного подпортили атмосферу оригинала.

Короче, ремастер тоже вышел не идеальным, в каком-то смысле прям как оригинал - хотели как лучше, а вот получилось далеко не всегда. По большей части ремастер все же удался, графику перерисовали и подтянули под современные разрешения экрана, добавили достижения (аркадные эпизоды проходить не заставляют даже ради ачивок, так что смело их пропускайте!), улучшили качество звука, ну и добавили приятные для фанатов бонусы вроде концепт-арта и комментариев разработчиков. Вступительные титры с той самой песней до сих пор вызывает мурашки по коже, атмосферу по дороге растеряли не всю, так что если мучает ностальгия, то брать ремастер стоит. Со скидкой или за полную цену - это уже в зависимости от того, насколько вы большой фанат, игра короткая даже по современным меркам, всего 3-4 часа на полное прохождение.

31423474.review:
Continuing its trend of remasters, Double Fine has injected new life into the cult favorite Full Throttle. Over the past couple of years, Double Fine has been putting a lot of love and care into some of the classic Lucasarts games of yore including Grim Fandango and Day of the Tentacle. Now some remasters come across as superfluous and lazy but in the case of this Lucasarts trio, it was quite the necessity seeing as how these games don’t really play nice with modern operating systems. As someone who missed these games the first time around, I’m quite glad to see that Double Fine is making them available for modern machines.

Although I had never played any of these classics when they originally released, I have been following their release quite closely as I’ve always heard them put in such high regard. And despite the critical acclaim of both Grim Fandango and Day of the Tentacle, Full Throttle seemed to be the one that fans seemed to be frothing at the mouth for the most, at least anecdotally. After finishing Full Throttle, I can see why. The game excels in a number of categories but presentation is the first that comes to mind. Set in a pseudo-Mad Max world, the world of Full Throttle creates an excellent sense of place. The dinginess and music all lend itself to the lawless world that the game tries to create. The voice acting is also exceptional, with the incomparable Mark Hamill making an appearance as well. One thing that did stand out for me that separates Full Throttle from its Lucasarts brethren is that the game is very filmic. It presents its shots and framing in a way that neither of the other two did and helps to create a wonderful sense of adventure. I can definitely see why this was such a big hit when it released in 1995.

As far as the gameplay goes, well, it’s still an adventure game from 1995. I have a certain love-hate relationship with classic point and click adventure games – I love their comedic aspects and stories but I find the puzzle solving to be overly obtuse and sometimes nonsensical. Full throttle was no different in this regard. I greatly enjoyed the story but found myself relying on a walkthrough to get me through much of the game. Purists may cry heresy over this but that’s the way I played the game and I still enjoyed it. I think it’s important to know what kind of puzzle solving you’re getting into here. There’s a reason games like these aren’t really made anymore.

When it comes to the state of the remaster, I found it to be pretty excellent. Like its predecessors, you can swap between the classic graphics and the remastered one. I did find myself constantly flipping between the two to see the changes that were made and see what the original was like. Overall, I’d say I enjoyed the classic graphics the most. The pixel art, especially in close ups, is still phenomenal. The characters have distinct silhouettes and strike some wonderful poses. During larger scale scenes though, I did find it better to switch to the new graphics if not for anything else than to make things a bit more legible and easier to navigate. The audio is also noticeably crisper if you have the remastered graphics on.

No matter which setting you prefer, Full Throttle Remastered is the definitive way to play the game. It’s still a terrific experience from a different time in gaming and one that I’m glad old and new gamers alike can experience. While the puzzles are still not all that great, I’d say don’t be afraid to use a guide if you want to experience this classic for first time or the fiftieth.

31407712.review:
This is the poorest made of the remakes/remasters that I've played in the genre. The graphical update is often underwhelming and, in a sense, too faithful to the original and all its artistic flaws. There are also a couple of bizarre graphical glitches as well as a lack of detail in the remaster, which caused me to play most of the game in its original incarnation -- you can choose between original and remastered graphics and audio as you play these remastered adventure games.

Aside from how lacklustre the remaster is on a technical level, the game itself is very interesting in many ways, with an intriguing plot of deceit and murder over big business and future ambition of the Corley Motors company and its owning partners, who share (or do they?) a passion for legacy motorbikes. Unfortunately, the game suffers from readability issues and isn't terribly intuitive in allowing you to really get a feel of what exists on the screen, which can lead to some frustrating misses of objects that need to be interacted with. It also feels a tad bit on the short side and overall it's marred with a lot of small problems which do detract from the overall experience of what is still a good game. All in all, the game lacks the cogency of most other LucasArts adventures.

The story is good, the voice acting is great, and it's really fun to enjoy the game again after all these years.

Final verdict for me: If you already really enjoy old Point n Click adventure games, this is an excellent addition to your collection. If you haven't played any/many, this is a really really bad place to start.

Glorious return of the fabulous classic and it (almost) looks and feels as a modern game too which is great for a 22 y.o. game. Trust me. Well, you don't have to. 31367405.review:
Set in a somewhat dystopian future in the year 2040, Full Throttle takes place in a world where hover-vehicles are slowly erasing their old fashioned, motorised counterparts from existence, and the few people to cling to the old ways are Ben Throttle and his gang, the Polecats.

Framed for the murder of Malcolm Corley, the CEO of Corley Motors, the last company to build motorized vehicles, Ben works to unveil the truth of the murder and clear his and his gang's name. After finding Maureen, the estranged daughter of Malcolm, he sets out to help her claim her rightful place.

For a game that is now 22 years old, Full Throttle's original graphics still look amazing and the original audio holds up, albeit a bit fuzzy. I opted to go for the remastered graphics and audio for the true remastered experience, despite this being my first play ever.

To be honest I just wanted to make full use of my monitor and not deal with those pesky black bars.

You can tell a lot of work was put into this overhaul, as switching seamlessly between rendering modes will show how much has changed, the colours are crisper and cleaner, there's more to the backgrounds too and the characters just look better overall.

There's no wall of text when it comes to choices like the stellar Day of the Tentacle or Secret of Monkey Island which gave you a multitude of ways to interact with people. In Full Throttle however, you play a biker so of course you think like a biker and so you either punch, kick, or talk to people or use objects in that manner.

While its neat that they simplified the UI in this, it also feels extremely simplified compared to previous LucasArts games.

Full Throttle has some truly stellar voice actors, I mean they had Mark Hammil voice the damn villain and he is superb as ever, he just emanates pure evilness as Ripburger. Roy Conrad's deep, gravelly voice suits Ben so perfectly that its a shame he didn't do much voice work after this. Kath Soucie voices Maureen and she's great, as a child I adored her as Phil and Lil from Rugrats. Can't forget her as Lola Bunny in Space Jam too but uh... thats a different thing altogether.

There was this one section in Mine Road where you have to acquire an item to get another one which in turn opens up the area you need to access. The worst part is that the enemies randomly spawn, so you have to either keep knocking out enemies or skipping the fights to get what you needed. This took way longer than it should have, and considering that the combat is also clunky as hell with the mouse controls, I failed a bunch before I finally succeeded, this was one area I was definitely glad to be done with.

Even playing for the first time, I didn't struggle with the puzzles, for the most part they had incredibly easy solutions or required some precise mouse positioning. They could be annoying but at least they weren't overcomplicated or required absurd solutions.

Overall the game took less than 5 hours for me to complete, even with me taking my time and exploring, but despite the short playtime I really enjoyed this game and it reminded me of how great LucasArts was during the 90's.

    The characters are interesting but with the short playtime, their storylines feel rushed
    Great music
    Humour is on point
    Extras such as concept art and commentary

Oh there was one small thing that bugged me, which is that you can only see the end credits in the original version and not the remastered. Not sure why but, there ya go.

31365768.review:
Full Throttle was one of the first games I ever played when I was a kid, and while I probably wouldn't have remembered the title off the top of my head prior to the Remastered announcement, those memories of the game remained and I often have flashbacks to playing it. As soon as I saw the Remaster, I knew it was a definite purchase. Its artwork and animations have stuck in my mind for all of these years (I turn 30 this year), yet the second I started the game, all of those many memories came back to me. 

The execution of this game has, so far, been flawless. The art has stayed true to the original while giving everything a modern visual upgrade; animations look fantastic, and the colours stand out beautifully. Switching between the remaster and original on-the-fly really drives home how magnificent both versions are; each respective of their eras. 

Double Fine have done it, once again. This is a testament to the quality of the game, and they have delivered a superb remaster. Highly recommended for both past, and new, players alike.

31326668.review:
Full Throttle is a point and click adventure title that was originally released in 1995 by LucasArts, a company better known for their Indiana Jones, Sam & Max, and Monkey Island series'. Don't feel bad if you've never heard of this game, as it's one of the more obscure LucasArts titles. Despite the fact that it sold over a million copies, it's still considered a cult classic, one that faded into obscurity until now. Back in the day, two sequels were planned but both ended up being scrapped.

Within the world of Full Throttle, the player will take on the role of Ben Throttle, the leader of a bike gang known as The Polecats. The year is 2040, and motorized vehicles are being replaced by anti-gravitational cars instead, meaning that motorcycles in general are about to go extinct. The last domestic manufacturer of these beloved two-wheeled beasts is Corley Motors, and Ben, along with his gang, end up running into the company's CEO, Malcolm Corley. Some things go down, and Ben realizes that the entire company is in jeopardy, which eventually leads to him attempting to solve a murder that he ends up getting pinned for. I can't go into too much detail here, as doing so would spoil a good chunk of the game.

The updated graphics are excellent, as always Double Fine have done an outstanding job of sticking to the original game, all the while giving Full Throttle a fresh coat of paint; one can even change between the new and old graphics seamlessly at any time with the press of a button. The voice-overs and soundtrack have also been given a dynamic boost, leading to all of this title's elements feeling brand new. There's also a good chunk of extra content included, such as concept art, developer commentary and the like, some of which is unlocked throughout your playthrough. 

The soundtrack and voice acting here are phenomenal. Many gamers who are in the age bracket of 25-35 will probably be more prone to recognizing many of the voices from various 90's cartoon shows and movies, such as Kath Soucie from Rugrats, Maurice LaMarche from Pinky and the Brain, and Tress MacNeille from Animaniacs; let's also not forget Mark Hamill who's the voice for Adrian Ripburger, the main antagonist. Needless to say, for its time it was an All Star line-up. As for the music, every song is performed by The Gone Jackals, and while the game doesn't feature any "hits", it's still a decent rock n' roll soundtrack.

Unfortunately, that's pretty much where the good side of Full Throttle ends, the remainder is just a pile of mediocre mush that ended up getting this revival thanks to the cult following that the game amassed. Do you like motorcycles? Explosions? Heavy Metal? A generic biker protagonist? Then this game still probably isn't for you. The plot is underwhelming, and the puzzles are some of the easiest in any point and click adventure game, which is odd for a title by LucasArts. The latter point leads to this game being very short, you will be hard pressed to squeeze out more than 3-4 hours of playtime, so it's up to you to decide if $16.99 CAD is worth the few hours of entertainment you'll get.

31319788.review: Was ist Vollgas ? Vollgas ist ein Point and Click Adventure aus dem Jahr 1995 welches ein wenig an ein Roadmovie aus dieser Zeit erinnert. Ihr spielt den Draufgänger Ben, welcher mich ein wenig an den guten alten Duke erinnert und müsst euch durch Rätsel, Kämpfe und Dialogen prügeln. Ben ist Chef einer Motorradgang und kommt dadurch in einer Situation in welche man eher nicht kommen sollte. Die anderen Figuren erscheinen mir eher fablos, was an Ihrem Charakter oder einfach daran liegt das Ben alles überstrahlt. Die Rätsel sind meines erachtens ( ich bin da kein guter vergleich) recht anspruchsvoll aber Schaffbar und an vielen stellen recht kreativ. Die Grafik ist wunderschön und einfach nur Zeitlos, das selbe gilt auch für die vertonung welche auch auf Deutsch super ist. Die Spielzeit von ca 3-5 Stunden ist zwar etwas kurz aber dafür gibt es keine stellen an welcher der Spielfluss gebrochen wird. Also wer auf ein wenig Trash steht und dieses Meilenstein noch nicht oder schon lange nicht mehr gespielt hat sollte hier sofort zuschlagen.

31316630.review:
В целом, это практически образцово-показательный ремастер: перерисованный графон и новый качественный звук (при этом по нажатию на F1 можно без каких бы то ни было проблем вернуться к оригинальному виду и звуку), поддержка широкоэкранных моников, больше деталей и прочего. В довесок — ачивки, саундтрек (старый и новый), комментарии, арты.

Конечно, можно было бы придраться к не самым аккуратным шрифтам, низкому качеству пожатого видео (а не векторной анимации) в роликах, что в эру 4к будет смотреться уже не то чтобы особо круто, отсутствие поддержки ultra-widecreen и вот этого всего, с заделом на будущее. Но это вполне себе продукт своего времени, сейчас нам дали возможность просто ещё разок пройти. Учитывая стоимость и время на прохождение (для тех, кто уже проходил, просмотр всех заставок и получение всех ачивок займёт не больше 4х часов), это прекрасный продукт.

Можно было бы и пожурить за пару досадных багов (зависания, в особенности на дороге), не всегда отзывчивое управление и по современным меркам несколько переусложнённый и неотзывчивый подход к интерфейсу. Но это, в принципе, лишь предложение вернуться назад во времени, понастольгировать или ещё чего подобного сообразить. С подобной задачей игра прекрасно справилась и заслуживает самой высокой оценки.

This is quite possibly my favorite adventure game ever.  Back when it first came out in the 90's, I was exposed to this game via a demo on a PC Gamer demo cd.  I played the hell out of the demo and bugged the hell out of my dad to buy the full game, which he was happy to do.  I played it multiple times until I had very well memorized the ENTIRE thing.  Seriously.  I memorized it.  A friend of mine got a copy of it, and I wrote a walkthrough for him from memory.  I usually play this game again from time to time, at least once a year, though I had to use ScummVM to make it work.

But now we have this game remastered in all it's 90's era glory!  I'm quite pleased with how this turned out, and playing through this brought back many fond memories.

Do Loom next.

Importante observar que há pequenos bugs na versão remaster, exemplo na tela de créditos que não aparecem as informações e alguns pequenos travamentos durante o game. Como há a possibilidade de revezar entre a versão clássica, basta alternar esta configuração para resolver temporariamente a questão. Parabéns pela iniciativa de remasterizar esses grandes clássicos de Lucas Arts.

31306806.review: What a nostalgic game, and the re-master is pretty good as well.  Some things look strange (like the rocks passing by in reverse when your driving down the road due to animation framerates), but overall it's a respectable improvement over the original.  I paid over $10 for this game, but I feel that the price was fair given the amount of playtime (some people might want to wait until it's under $7).  If you have already played the game then you could probably fly through it in a couple hours, but some puzzles will give newcomers a total playtime of 6 hours or more.  It's not a long game, but I enjoyed it; good job on the additions, Double Fine.

31304091.review:
[h1] Full Throttle [/h1]

[b]Introdução[/b]

Foi um jogo desenvolvido pela [b]LucasArts[/b] em 1995. O jogo foi produzido utilizando o motor SCUMM, que é uma linguagem de programação (motor de jogo) para os games de [b]point-and-click[/b]

O jogo começa quando [b]Ben[/b] e seu moto Club [b]Polecats[/b] passam ao lado de uma limusine e destroem um pequeno ornamento na frente do capô. Um tempo depois, a limusine encosta no bar onde eles costumam frequentar: [b]Kick Stand Bar[/b], onde um dos passageiros, [b]Ripburger[/b] faz uma proposta ao [b]Ben[/B] de serem os guarda-costas da Corley Motors, na qual seu dono [b]Malcolm Corley[/b] estaria muito velho. [B]Ben[/b] se nega a realizar o serviço e os capangas do [b]Ripburger[/b] armam uma cilada tanto para o [b]Ben[/B] quanto para o moto Club inteiro. E é aí que o jogo começa.

[b]A resmaterização é boa?[/b]

A responsável pela remasterização é a empresa [b]Double Fine[/b], a mesma que remasterizou [b]Day of the Tentacle[/b] e [b]Grim Fandango[/b], grandes clássicos de 1993 e 1998. O jogo funciona tão bem (e isso vocês vão perceber pela quantidade de horas que já joguei) que faz valer cada segundo. Os gráficos são todos refinados e sabem do melhor? Se forem saudosistas (como eu), podem ativar no menu configurações os gráficos originais do jogo. E só constando, tanto os gráficos quanto as dublagens podem ser alteradas (remasterizadas / originais). 

[b]Vale pagar R$20-30?[/B]

Bem, eu geralmente compro os jogos no boleto, mas quando fui olhar a lista dos jogos mais vendidos e me deparei com esse título, peguei o cartão e paguei os R$22,50 (promoção de 20%), pois foi um dos melhores jogos de  [b]point-and-click[/b] que já joguei, obviamente ao lado de Monkey Island. Ter oito anos e jogar esses jogos me fizeram gastar vários neurônios tentando resolver, ainda mais sem saber na época o mínimo do inglês hahahahahaha

Voltando ao assunto, se vale a pena, bem o jogo não conta com nenhuma novidade. É a mesma coisa, mudando apenas os gráficos e áudios. Porém, a mesma experiência proposta pela LucasArts permanece. É um jogo que vai garantir umas 10-15 horas de muita diversão, ótimos diálogos e trilhas. 

[b]Positivos:[/b]
[list]
[*]Preço acessível
[*]Gráficos e áudios totalmente melhorados
[*]A história é muito boa
[*]Perfeito pra quem quiser jogar no Joystick
[/list]

[b]"Negativo" (coloquei em aspas porquê não acho que isso seja um problema[/b]
[list]
[*]O jogo não traz nenhuma novidade
[/list]

31300867.review:
Mi opinión va al respecto de la remasterización, no del juego en si. Full Throttle me lo pasé en su día y me lo he pasado varias veces a lo largo de los años. Me parece una buena aventura de LucasArts, lo cual ya lo situaría entre las mejores aventuras de la historia, pero ni de lejos me parece una de sus mejores aventuras. Es un juego simple, el resideño del SCUMM fue muy mejorable, es muy corto y la sección de la autopista, una buena parte del juego, sobra bastante.

La remasterización, sin embargo, es la típica holgazanería de Tim Schafer cuyos últimos años parecen más enfocados a su canal de Youtube que a hacer juegos con una calidad acorde a su importancia en la industria.

Ciertos gráficos han sido creados desde cero con un buen grado de detalle y gran calidad artística, como los personajes y algunos objetos, pero a los fondos sencillamente se les ha añadido un filtrado horrible (estilo xBRZ), lo cual hace que vayan desde lo aceptable hasta lo más chabacano que te puedas imaginar. Hay fondos concretos, como la choza del tío Pete o la guarida del avión Jumbo, que son una desgracia visual. Al menos crearon nuevo contenido para rellenar hasta los 16:9 y no hicieron el recorte de pantalla de Grim Fandango, algo es algo..

Pero su mayor problema es que el juego no tiene un solo frame de animación nuevo con lo que sigue yendo a los clásicos 10-15 frames de animación por segundo, exceptuando algunas animaciones de la autopista, lo que con los nuevos gráficos hace que quede aún más tosco de lo que quedaba en su día.

Obviamente todo esto es al respecto de los nuevos gráficos. Siempre se puede elegir el pixel-art original a 4:3 y disfrutar de los gráficos originales. En cuyo caso, en mi opinión, sigue no recomendando el juego porque no ofrece absolutamente nada sobre ScummVM + el juego original que algunos ya tenemos.

12€ por una ejecución nativa en Windows 10 me parece demasiado dinero y por eso no recomiendo esta obra como remasterización. Como juego desde luego sí lo recomiendo, aunque recomendaría antes algunos otros juegos de LucasArts.

En Steam no me lo he pasado porque tardó un par de días más en aparecer respecto a GOG, quién sabe porqué. A lo que habría que sumar las 5-10 veces que me lo he pasado en su versión original antes que esta remasterización.

Si ponéis Full Throttle Remake en Google Imágenes, la primera de ellas es un impresionante artwork creado por un tal luisimage hace siglos. Eso, concretamente, es lo que hubiera esperado de una remasterización actualizada.

31295882.review:
LucasArts (= LA) war schon eine ganz besondere Spieleschmiede. Mich begleitet immer ein wenig Wehmut bei dem Gedanken dass diese einst unter Gamern so beliebte wie auch renommierte Kultfabrik zwar noch auf dem Papier existiert, in der heutigen Branchenentwicklung jedoch keine tragende Rolle mehr spielt. Von ihr gingen über zwei ganze Jahrzehnte eine Vielzahl überragender Titel hervor, von denen nicht wenige noch heute als Klassiker ihres Fachs gezählt und unter „Zocker-Opas“ als zeitlose Spiele-Perlen geradezu angehimmelt werden. Nebenbei bemerkt: Ich bekenne mich ganz ohne Scham – dafür mit jeder Menge Stolz - diesen „alten Säcken“ anzugehören. :p
Besonders an Adventure-Hits der oben genannten Adresse hatte es seit Ende der 1980er nicht gemangelt, darunter populäre Meisterwerke die in keinen Videospiel-Geschichtsbuch wegzudenken sind und allein bei der Erwähnung ihrer Namen augenblickliche Seufzer purster Entzückung entlocken. „Monkey Island“, „Indiana Jones“, Sam & Max“, „Day of the Tentacle“… Und zu diesen altehrwürdigen Meisterwerken muss auch das seinerzeit (meiner Meinung nach) völlig unterschätzte „Vollgas – Full Throttle“ (FT) dazugezählt werden. Wie zuvor schon mit „Grim Fandango“ und „Day of the Tentacle“ geschehen, hat der geistige Vater Tim Schafer mit seinem Double Fine-Team auch dieses Schmuckstück der VGA-Pixel-Ära HD- (und sogar 4k-) tauglich geliftet. Alte Hasen wie auch Jungspieler können sich glücklich schätzen dieses stilistisch einzigartige Adventure mit der wohl coolsten Sau unter den LA-Protagonisten in zeitgemäßer Qualität (er)neu(t) kennenlernen zu dürfen. 

Sandige Endzeit-Landschaft die mich umgibt, der Fahrtwind der mir beim Ritt auf meiner Höllenmaschine ins Gesicht bläst, dazu rockige Mucke von den Gone Jackals, und dann noch die kratzige 2-Schachteln-Marlboro-am-Tag-Stimme von Ben. Das ist die Welt vom „Full Throttle Remastered“ (= FTR), einem interaktiven Road-Movie, in welchem dem Gang-Anführer der Polecats ein Mord in die Schuhe geschoben wird, und zwar an Malcolm Corley, dem letzten Motorrad-Hersteller des hiesigen Landes. Ben ist - wie sich jeder denken kann - natürlich stinksauer, weil er sich nicht gerne linken lässt. Und weil Motorräder sein Leben sind. Also setzt er alles daran den Namen seiner Jungs wieder reinzuwaschen und Ripburger, den Stellvertreter von Corley Motors und tatsächlichen Mörder, zur Strecke zu bringen…

Im eigenen LA-Portfolio und auch unter Genre-Fans hat FT einen gewissen Sonderlingsstatus, der sich mit seiner recht kurzen Spielzeit und für LA-Verhältnisse eher geringen Rätseldichte erklärt. Geht man als totale Jungfrau ans Spiel heran kommen bis zum Abspann allerhöchstens 5-6 Stunden zusammen, da trotz durchaus vorhandener Knobelaufgaben richtig knackige Kopfnüsse ausbleiben, das klassische Inventar marginal befüllt wird und die allermeisten Lösungen quasi auf der Hand liegen. Auch zwischendurch eingebettete Action-Sequenzen wie Bike-Prügeleien auf dem Highway sind Gründe dafür dass FT nicht zur anspruchsvollsten Sorte damaliger Adventures gehört und sich gerade deshalb für echte Adventure-Anfänger ohne große Genre-Erfahrung prädestiniert.
Dennoch, FT verdient wegen anderer Stärken besondere Anerkennung. Tim Schafers Handschrift ist in keiner Sekunde zu übersehen; der erwachsene Comic-Look, der herrlich dreckige Humor und eine Vielzahl an erinnerungswürdigen Figuren zeugen davon. Vor allem Ben Throttle – ich wusste bis zum Remaster-Release gar nicht dass der tatsächlich einen Nachnamen hat *lach* - mit seiner kantigen wie kaltschnäuzigen Art, der auch mal gerne mit der Faust oder seinem Stiefel antwortet, ist ein, wenn nicht sogar DAS Highlight dieses Spiels. Immer einen knochentrockenen Spruch auf den Lippen, immer fürs Grobe zu haben. Nicht weniger kultig wie Guybrush Threepwood und Co., obwohl (oder gerade weil) er ein Typ von ganz anderem Schlag ist. Hervorzuheben ist auch dass FT seinerzeit das Medium CD-Rom als erstes LA-Adventure für mehr als nur die bloße Vollvertonung auszunutzen wusste. Die immense Zahl an Story-Sequenzen und viele dreidimensionale Grafik-Elemente die sich in der Regel perfekt in die klassischen 2D-Hintergründe einfügen sorgten dafür dass FT wesentlich cineastischer rüberkam als alle seine innerfamiliären Genre-Geschwister vor und nach ihm.

Beim Remastern von FT hat sich Schafers Studio wieder einmal richtig ins Zeug gelegt. Die originalen Grafik-Vorlagen wurden mit viel Liebe nachgezeichnet und fürs 16:9-Format seitlich erweitert. Stark hervorgehobene Details, vor allem bei Figuren-Gesichtern und Backgrounds die man im VGA-Urspiel allerhöchstens erahnen konnte erstrahlen nun in messerscharfer Güte. Der besondere Zeichenstil mit seinen satten Farben und harten Konturen hat nie besser ausgesehen, manchmal fragt man sich warum Schafer nie einen abendfüllenden Trickfilm im Stile FT rausgebracht hat. Er und seinen Mannen hätten ohne Frage das Talent und die Möglichkeiten…
Bei der Überarbeitung der Grafik wurde es allerdings nicht belassen, auch der Sound trumpft in der Remastered-Version so was von auf. Mal ab von multilingualer Unterstützung in Sprache und Text steht sogar die Wahl zwischen dem originalen (deutschen wie englischen) Ton der aus Kompressionsgründen von leichtem Hintergrundrauschen begleitet wird und der aufgefrischten Spur die nun glasklar und ohne hörbare Verzerrungen ertönt. Selbst bevorzuge ich natürlich die ältere Audio-Qualität, ein bisschen Oldie-Feeling muss schon sein. ;)
Als besonderes Extra gibt es zu guter letzt Einblicke in die Entwicklung von FT in Form von Original-Skizzen und eines Audiokommentars der wichtigsten Köpfe hinter Bens Abenteuer, darunter auch Entwickler-Ikone Schafer himself.

Fazit:
Bravo, Double Fine. Zum dritten Male habt ihr ein Klassiker-Remaster versprochen und Wort gehalten, wobei ihr bei FTR wohl die bis dato beste „Restaurierungsarbeit“ geleistet habt. Selbst für Besitzer des Urspiels (wie meine Wenigkeit) ist die Neuanschaffung unbedingte Pflicht, und auch jedem anderen Adventure-Fan ist FTR ungeachtet seiner relativem Kürze und seines recht niedrigen Schwierigkeitsgrades wärmstens zu empfehlen. Schafer und FT - das ist Kult pur! :)

31284692.review:
Without a doubt my favourite game from my childhood. Being able to relive my old memories from the game and to be able to change between old and remastered graphics as well as sound was amazing. For its current price it may seem a little pricey for such an old game, but considering the remastered graphics sound and music, it is worth paying the full price to relive the old memories of it (if you have played the original game) or if you would just like to play a classic that is well remastered, go ahead and buy it.

[h1]Pros: [/h1]
-Able to switch between original pixelated and newly remastered graphics as well as sound with the click of a button
-Great story
-Easy to use controls
-Newly added main menu, allows you to save, load saves, has a bonus menu and more
-Selective dialogues
-Skippable cutscenes
-Skippable Dialogue
-You are able to interact with certain objects in the game and as you progress further, you will need to find certain objects along the way.
-Able to interact with other characters, this being talking to or fighting other bikers on the road with your fists, feet, or weapons that you find along the way

[h1]Cons:[/h1]
-Short game, can be finished in under 3 hours (The original game was released in 1995 which is understandable)
-Can seem 'too easy', requiring simple thinking to continue further through the story

[h1]TL:DR[/h1]
Overall I would rate this game 9/10. The game may be short but it is worth replaying to get 100% completion. The game allows for overall great interaction with the other characters, being fighting other bikers, using objects scattered around the world to progress further into the game and the dialogue with other characters. Easy at times, certain parts will leave you thinking or send you off to Google to find out how to pass it. Other than that, I cannot find more fault in the game, it remains my favourite game from my childhood.

31284077.review: Full Throttle Remastered é a versão remasterizada de um clássico Adventure (ou point-and-click) da LucasArts. Sendo que jogava esse jogo quando pequeno, tenho um grande valor sentimental por ele. E posso afirmar que essa versão faz justiça ao original: tudo foi redesenhado a mão, e as músicas e dublagens foram remasterizadas também. Além de comentários em áudio, artes conceituais e um Jukebox, o jogo ainda deixa você jogar a versão original ao pressionar a tecla F1. O jogo está traduzido para o Português Brasileiro, apesar de a legenda não ter aparecido para mim algumas vezes em cutscenes. No início também tem algumas quedas de frames, mas são bem rápidas e não ocorreram após isso. Se você quer conhecer esse jogo, ou revisitá-lo depois de anos, essa é uma excelente opção.

Для желающих прочуствовать какого оно было 20 лет назад есть режим Classic для картинки, звука и управления.
Английский язык здесь очень простой, хватает знания ниже среднего, чтобы понять весь смысл и не было сложности в прохождении, зато диалоги и интонации на высоте. В общем всем рекомендую, и кто помнит её и кому она в новинку!
